contentrichtext.text: '''Chełm i Gdańsk-Południe''' ({{lang-de|Stolzenberg}}) is in the south-central suburbs of the city of [[Gdańsk]], [[Poland]]. The Chelm-Gdansk Cemetery (54º22 18º36) is a 2.3 hectare [[Jewish]] cemetery, with graves of the [[Jewish community of Danzig]] dating from the 1860s. The cemetery survived [[the Holocaust]] times in good condition. It was closed in 1956 and seriously devastated in the following years. It currently remains in dilapidated condition. The land has been reclaimed by the Jewish community, which has roots in the community going back to at least 1694. The '''International Jewish Cemetery Project''' of the '''International Association of Jewish Genealogical Societies''' is tracking its restoration. <ref>International Jewish Cemetery Project [http://www.jewishgen.org/cemetery/e-europe/pol-g.html Jewish Cemeteries in Poland Beginning with the Letter G]</ref> == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.gis.gdansk.pl/ipg/index.en.html Interactive map of Gdansk includes Chełm i Gdańsk-Południe] * [http://gdansk.jewish.org.pl/index.php?lg=pl&kat=4&dzial=55&typ=3 Photographs of the Cemetery] * [http://www.kirkuty.xip.pl/gdanskchelm.htm Photographs of the Cemetery] * [http://www.inyourpocket.com/poland/gdansk/sightseeing/category/260-Jewish_Gdansk.html Jewish Gdansk, including article on Chelm Cemetery] {{Gdańsk}} {{coord missing|Pomeranian Voivodeship}} [[Category:Gdańsk|Chelm i Gdansk-Poludnie]] [[Category:Jewish cemeteries in Poland]] {{Pomorze-geo-stub}} [[pl:Chełm i Gdańsk Południe]]
